required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment Trial of Thermoregulatory Disturbances in Adolescent Anorexia Nervosa Patients With Either Ginger Powder Footbaths or Warm Water Footbaths
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Foot Baths With and Without Ginger Powder Additive on the Subjective Feeling of Warmth and on Body Core Temperature of Adolescents With Anorexia Nervosa - a Randomized, Controlled Pilot Study

lead_sponsor.agency: ARCIM Institute Academic Research in Complementary and Integrative Medicine

clinical_study.source: ARCIM Institute Academic Research in Complementary and Integrative Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: A study to explore whether warm water footbaths with added ginger powder can improve thermoregulatory processes in adolescent anorexia nervosa patients and provide them with an increase in subjective feeling of warmth. The participants will receive a warm footbath four times a week for six weeks with a physiological and psychological testing point once before the beginning of the six-week footbath period and once after.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a two-arm randomized controlled trial to evaluate the efficacy of warm water footbaths with added ginger powder (experimental) compared to warm water only footbaths (control) in adolescent anorexia nervosa patients. Participants will receive footbaths 4 times per week before bed-time over a period of six weeks.The main focus is on subjective increase in overall body warmth. Moreover, core body temperature, skin temperature at the extremities and several psychological as well as physiological scores and parameters are assessed before and after the six-week intervention. A follow-up is planned at six months post intervention, where core body temperature, physiological and psychological parameters are once more tested.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants are age and core body temperature stratified and then randomized to one of the two groups (footbath with warm water with additional ginger powder or warm water only). Assessments are taken before and after the six-week intervention phase as well as at six-month follow-up.

primary_outcome.measure: Chnge in Subjective feeling of overall warmth
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre intervention), 6 weeks after baseline (post intervention)
primary_outcome.description: Self-reported feeling of overall warmth measured using the HeWEF 1.2 (Herdecker Wärmeempfindungs-Fragebogen) overall warmth perception questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre intervention), once per week during intervention, 6 weeks after baseline (post intervention), at six-month follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Core body temperature measured using an infrared tympanical thermometer as used in clinical routine

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre intervention) and 6 weeks after baseline (post intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Surface temperature in the face measured using high-resolution infrared thermography

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre intervention) and 6 weeks after baseline(post intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Surface temperature at the feet measured using high-resolution infrared thermography

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre intervention) and 6 weeks after baseline(post intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Surface temperature on the hands measured using high-resolution infrared thermography

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre intervention) and after 6 weeks (post intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Surface temperature at the abdomen measured using high-resolution infrared thermography

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Over 24 hours at baseline (pre intervention) and over 24 hours 6 weeks after baseline(post intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: 24 hour surface temperature at the feet measured using a surface data-logger (i-Button TM)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Over 24 hours at baseline (pre intervention) and over 24 hours 6 weeks after baseline (post intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: 24 hour surface temperature on the hands measured using a surface data-logger (i-Button TM)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Over 24 hours at baseline (pre intervention) and over 24 hours 6 weeks after baseline (post intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: 24 hour surface temperature at the abdomen measured using a surface data-logger (i-Button TM)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Over 24 hours at baseline (pre intervention) and over 24 hours 6 weeks after baseline (post intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: 24 hour surface temperature at the upper torso measured using a surface data-logger (i-Button TM)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre intervention),weekly during intervention, 6 weeks after baseline (post intervention) and at six-month follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Body Mass Index (BMI) Calculated as (Weight in Kg)/〖(Height in m)^2〗

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Continuously over 15 minutes at baseline (pre intervention) and 6 weeks after baseline (post intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: PTT in ms, measured with the GeTeMed Vitaguard 3100

secondary_outcome.description: Quotient of heart and respiratory rates measured with the GeTeMed Vitaguard 3100

secondary_outcome.description: beats per minute (bpm) measured with the GeTeMed Vitaguard 3100

secondary_outcome.description: measured with the GeTeMed Vitaguard 3100

secondary_outcome.measure: SDNN (standard deviation of normal to normal)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Continuously over 15 minutes at baseline (pre intervention) and 6 weeks after baseline (post intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Standard deviation of normal to normal beats, measured with the GeTeMed Vitaguard 3100

secondary_outcome.measure: RMSSD (Root mean square of successive differences)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Continuously over 15 minutes at baseline (pre intervention) and 6 weeks after baseline(post intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Root mean square of successive differences, measured with the GeTeMed Vitaguard 3100

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Continuously over 15 minutes at baseline (pre intervention) and 6 weeks after baseline (post intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of pairs of successive heart rate intervals that differ by more than 50 ms

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Continuously over 15 minutes at baseline (pre intervention) and 6 weeks after baseline(post intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the curve between the frequency of 0.15 to 0.4Hz measured with the GeTeMed Vitaguard 3100

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Continuously over 15 minutes at baseline (pre intervention) and 6 weeks after baseline (post intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the curve between the frequency of 0.04 to 0.15Hz measured with the GeTeMed Vitaguard 3100

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Continuously over 15 minutes at baseline (pre intervention) and 6 weeks after baseline (post intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Ratio of two bands from frequency domain analysis: LF band (0.04-0.15 Hz), HF band (0.15-0.40 Hz), measured with the GeTeMed Vitaguard 3100

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre intervention), 6 weeks after baseline (post intervention), at six-month follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Scores of the PSQI (Pittsburgh sleep quality index)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre intervention), 6 weeks after baseline (post intervention), at six-month follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Scores of the EDI-2 (Eating Disorder Inventory)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre intervention), 6 weeks after baseline (post intervention), at six-month follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Scores of the EDE-Q (Eating Disorder Examination)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre intervention), 6 weeks after baseline (post intervention), at six-month follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Scores of the BDI-II (Becks Depression Inventar)

secondary_outcome.measure: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale subscale Anxiety
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre intervention), 6 weeks after baseline (post intervention), at six-month follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Anxiety Sum-Score of the HADS (Hospital Anxiety and Depression scale) ranging from 0-21 with a cutoff at >10 (being evaluated as pathological)

secondary_outcome.measure: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale subscale Depression
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre intervention), 6 weeks after baseline (post intervention), at six-month follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Depression Sum-Score of the HADS (Hospital Anxiety and Depression scale) ranging from 0-21 with a cutoff at >10 (being evaluated as pathological)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre intervention),6 weeks after baseline (post intervention), at six-month follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Mean of all six item values (range from 0-9) with higher values indicating a positive body image state of the BISS (Body Image State Scale)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre intervention), 6 weeks after baseline (post intervention), at six-month follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Scores of the PANAS-X (Positive and negative affect schedule)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre intervention), 6 weeks after baseline (post intervention), at six-month follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Scores of the SF-12 (Short Form 12)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre intervention), once per week during intervention, 6 weeks after baseline(post intervention), at six-month follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Scores of the BBS (Basler Befindlichkeits Skala =basler mood questionnaire)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre intervention), once per week during intervention,6 weeks after baseline (post intervention), at six-month follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Scores of the BSQ (Body Shape Questionnaire)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Warm water with ginger powder footbath
arm_group.description: Participants who receive a warm water with added ginger powder footbath four times a week over a six-week period.
Participants who receive a warm water only footbath four times a week over a six-week period.

intervention.description: 38-40° C warm water footbath with an additive of dried ginger powder reaching up to mid-calf level, as practiced in anthroposophic medicine
intervention.arm_group_label: Warm water with ginger powder footbath

intervention.description: 38-40° C warm water footbath without any additive reaching up to mid-calf level

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- main diagnosis: Anorexia nervosa
- written informed consent of participants and legal guardians
Exclusion Criteria:
- other eating disorder diagnosis apart from Anorexia nervosa
- known allergic reaction to ginger
